title: Son accidentally shoots dad in leg while turkey hunting in Sanilac County
content:
SANILAC COUNTY, MI - A 15-year-old boy accidentally shot his father while turkey hunting in Sanilac County, police said.
About 3:30 p.m. on May 20, 47-year-old Troy Davis of Croswell was hunting with his son when he was struck in the leg with birdshot pellets, according to a press release from the Sanilac County Sheriff's Office.
The pair were hunting in the 200 block of Ridge Road, according to deputies.
Police said the son shot at a turkey and didn't realize his father was in a position behind it. Davis was struck in the leg from approximately 60 yards away, according to police.
He was treated at McKenzie Hospital for the leg injury and released later that day, police said.
